Introduction to typstable

typstable.Rmd

Introduction

The purpose of typstable /ˈtaɪps.tə.bᵊl/ is to produce publication-ready tables for Quarto documents targeting the Typst format. Typst is a modern, open-source, markup-based typesetting system that provides an alternative to LaTeX for rendering PDF documents. This package fills the gap for R users who need Typst tables with non-trivial formatting.

Installation

# Install from GitHub
pak::pak("freierson/typstable")

Getting Started

Create a basic table with tt():

library(typstable)
tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3])
tbl

Table Styling

Use tt_style() to customize the table appearance:

tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3],
          col_names = c("Miles/Gallon", "Cylinders", "Displacement")) |>
  tt_style(
    striped = TRUE,
    header_separate = TRUE,
    inset = "8pt"
  )
tbl

Column, Row, and Cell Formatting

Format specific parts of the table with tt_column(), tt_row(), and tt_cell():

tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_column(mpg, align = "right") |>
  tt_row(1, bold = TRUE) |>
  tt_cell(2, 2, background = "yellow")
tbl

Column Widths

Control column widths with tt_widths(). Values are proportional:

tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_style(stroke = TRUE) |>
  tt_widths(1, 2, 1)  # 25%, 50%, 25%
tbl

Spanning Headers

Add spanning headers with tt_header_above():

tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:4]) |>
  tt_style(header_separate = TRUE) |>
  tt_header_above(c("Performance" = 2, "Engine" = 2))
tbl

Row Grouping

Group rows with tt_pack_rows():

tbl <- tt(mtcars[1:6, 1:3]) |>
  tt_pack_rows("4 Cylinders", 1, 2) |>
  tt_pack_rows("6 Cylinders", 3, 6)
tbl

Saving Tables

Use tt_save() to export tables to SVG, PNG, PDF, or Typst source:

# Save as SVG
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_save("table.svg")

# Save as PNG with higher resolution
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_save("table.png", ppi = 300)

# Save as PDF
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_save("table.pdf")

# Save Typst source (no CLI required)
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3]) |>
  tt_save("table.typ")

Note: SVG, PNG, and PDF export requires the Typst CLI. Install from https://typst.app/.
